feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Cloud Identity Services
feed.subtitle: SAP Cloud Identity Services Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: IAS Tenant
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

As far as I know, it was previously recommended to use the Test IAS tenant only for testing purposes (i.e. Sandbox), and to use the Productive IAS tenant for productive cloud applications as well as for development and test environments.

Previous recommendation:

  • IAS Test → Sandbox environments
  • IAS Prod → PROD, DEV, and QAS

My question to the community:

What is the current recommended approach?

Should this setup still be followed:

    • IAS Test → Sandbox environments (only testing)
    • IAS Prod → PROD, DEV, and QAS ( SAC PROD + SAC QAS)

Or does SAP now recommend a different model, for example:

  • IAS Test → for development and test environments
  • IAS Prod → only for PROD

I would like to make this decision for our landscape (e.g. SAC QAS & PROD) and would appreciate an up-to-date assessment of which option is currently considered Best Practice.

Thank you in advance

Best Regards

entry.title: How can I replicate the passwords defined in SAP IAS to my destination system
entry.content:
I'm using IAS as the source and S4HANA on-premise as the target, and I've already implemented user replication.

However, I'm having a problem. I want to use the same password that each user has defined in SAP IAS so they can log into the S4HANA system, but I haven't been able to. The only thing I see in the transformations default code indicates that a random password is created with certain requirements, such as character count, uppercase and lowercase letters, etc.

 

Does anyone know if this is possible?

If it is, could you guide me on the configuration I should change?

entry.title: Transport app to another BTP subaccount
entry.content:
Hi Community,
how can I transport an app (e.g. SAP IAS) from one BTP subaccount to another ?

Thanks for your help.

 

Best Regards

entry.title: What is the right (SCI) IPS Connector for SAP HANA DB Platform (On-Premise) and SAP HANA (XSA)?
entry.content:
Hello SAP Product Experts,

I wish to connect SAP Cloud Identity Services (SCI): Identity Provisioning Service IPS to a SAP HANA Database Platform (On-Premise) system and also to the SAP HANA extended application services, advanced model (XSA) to maintain users and roles in these environments.

The SAP Help Portal available SAP HANA Cloud, SAP HANA Database Source and Target System connectors imply that the SAP HANA database application is running on SAP Business Technology Platform, which is not the setup I wish to connect to.

Our SAP HANA Database Platform is (On-Premise).

Can you please advise which is the correct IPS connector to use and provide step by step instructions on how to configure the connector to use SCI IPS to maintain users and roles/groups in these systems. 

  1. SAP HANA Database Platform (On-Premise) system
  2.  SAP HANA extended application services, advanced model (XSA)

Thanks for your assistance in advance.

entry.title: How to identify a Corporate IDP in the URL when using the DynamicIdentityProvider in SAP AppRouter
entry.content:
We are in the process of building a custom application which will be used by both employees and customers and therefore want to have each group authenticate against their respective Corporate IDP.

The custom CAP application is deployed into a BTP subacccount which has been configured with the trust to the SAP Cloud Identity Service (lets call it "SAP CIS External") instance intended specifically for this externally facing application.  We have a separate SAP Cloud Identity Service (lets call it "SAP CIS Internal") which is used for employee authentication by this application and other applications including Fiori for internal use only.

The "SAP CIS External" has 2 Corporate IDPs configured:

  1. ADFS - to be used for authenticating external customers. Configured as the default 'Corporate IDP'
  2. "SAP CIS Internal" - to be used for authenticating employees

Based on the following documentation, I understand that I should be able to use a URL to direct authentication to "SAP CIS Internal" as the 'alternate' Corporate IDP,  thus not using the default Corporate IDP configured. This would allow customers to use the 'default' Corporate IDP while internal employees will be provided a specific URL for them to access this application using our internal IDP.

  • https://help.sap.com/docs/btp/sap-business-technology-platform/environment-variables?locale=en-US
    • Refer: 'DYNAMIC_IDENTITY_PROVIDER' Environment variable
  • https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-identity-services/cloud-identity-services/create-url-to-access-saml-oidc-application-with-specific-identity-provider
  • https://www.npmjs.com/package/@sap/approuter#dynamic-identity-provider-configuration

Questions:

  1. What is the name of the 'Corporate IDP' I should be using for the URI parameter 'sap_idp'?
    • Based on the documentation it states that the 'Display Name' should not be used, but there is no alternative name. Neither work anyway.
    • The examples provided show the usage of a protocol and domain (eg. sap_idp=https://corp_idp_2.mydomain.com) but does not indicate how to source this value. Multiple values have been tested and do not work.
  2. How should the Dynamic Identity Provider setting be configured as my current configuration is not working?
    1. Configured the 'route' in our AppRouter to have the setting =>  "dynamicIdentityProvider": true
    2. Set the environment variable "DYNAMIC_IDENTITY_PROVIDER" in the AppRouter CAP in subaccount and space to have a value of => true

entry.title: Reset password email sent every day
entry.content:
Dear experts,

I receive 3-5 emails every day from IAS  that there have been 5 login attempts and my password is locked.

The emails arrive in the middle of the night, and sometimes over the day.

I do not try to login, so the messages are not triggered by my own failed attempts.

In the IAS troubleshooting log the failed login attempts are coming from the IP address 3.124.174.204.

"2025-07-25 03:37:56.940 UTC","3.124.174.204",anonymous,INFO,"FFB8B96D-C83A-4889-B7E0-215D2E7BFCA9","state=""aborted"", action=""login"", objectType=""user"", objectId=""jxxxxx"", message=""Authentication for user "xxxx failed"", category=""audit.authentication"", duration=""34 ms"",

This IP is something from Amazon, but i can only see this via Whois query, without more details.

How can I stop this? How can I find out more details of who or waht service tries to use my credentials to login to some application?

Thank you

Johannes

entry.title: Push users,groups, data from OneIdentity to Cloud Identity Services IAS
entry.content:
Hello

 

In the guide the source for CIS is being read by IPS.

Is it possible to have OneIdentity as source and have it push user,groups, data to Cloud Identity Services IAS?

 

So IAS is being fed by OneIdentity instead of having IAS reading OneIdentity

 

thanks

Sander

entry.title: IAS service binding auto-rotates X.509
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We are using IAS with a Cloud Foundry application, and we provision IAS users through the User Management REST API https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-identity-services/cloud-identity-services/user-management-rest-api.

Our IAS instance allows X.509 credentials, and the application uses the X.509 certificate automatically generated in the service binding.

During deployment, Cloud Foundry recreates the binding, and we consistently observe the following:

Behaviour

Every time the service binding is recreated, IAS issues a new X.509 certificate, even when the previous one has not expired.

When the certificate is rotated, IAS automatically disables “API Access for application users”, and the User Management REST API stops working until we manually re-enable it.

The certificate rotation and permission toggle happen even if nothing in the IAS configuration changed.

Questions

Is this the expected behaviour in IAS/Cloud Foundry? Does IAS always regenerate a new X.509 credential whenever a CF binding is recreated?

If this is expected, what is the recommended way to avoid breaking the User Management REST API during deployments? Should we avoid certificate-based credentials for apps that use the User Management API?

Goal

We want to prevent situations where the User Management REST API suddenly stops working after a deployment.

Any guidance, recommended patterns, or confirmations of expected behaviour would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud session cookies remain after corporate IdP logout
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community!

currently we are facing an issue with our SAP Analytics Cloud, or rather the session management of the product. We created different stories in our SAC which we embedded in our corporate environment so our customers and employees can use them. This is done via iFrame. 

Our SAC has an Cloud Identity Instance as an IdP configured while the Cloud Identity Instance uses a Microsoft based corporate IdP where all SSO requests are forwarded. 

Now for the actual issue: After user A logs initiates a logoff in the corporate environment the session is terminated and the user is forwared to the login page again. But if user B does a login the SAC still has the session cookes from user A active and no further authentication flow is triggered. This means that user B works with the SAC user A until the browser is actually closed (since that is the cookie lifetime) 

We were under the impression that when the corporate IdP terminates the session, the Cloud Identity Service "tells" the Analytics Cloud to delete the session + cookies as well. 

Does anybody have a similar experience with SAC integrations via iFrame?

entry.title: Onboarding 2.0 IAS/IPS provisioning: Hire gets two provisioning emails if rehire
entry.content:
Hello,

We have completed our IAS/IPS Tenant Migration and activated the ‘real-time sync’ functionality for our Onboarding 2.0 application. In addition, we have the switch “Retain Onboarding Username for Rehire on Old Employment” active in Onboarding General Settings.

Prior to the IAS/IPS Tenant migration and the real-time sync, the following process took place:

  1. The Review New Hire Data step is completed by HR. IPS Read Job creates Onboarding credentials and provisioning email is sent from IAS.
  2. Hire enters SSN/DOB into Onboarding. This triggers the Rehire Validation check assuming the hire is a rehire.
  3. HR completes the Rehire Validation check and selects “Rehire with Old Employment”.
  4. Existing IAS username and password is retained by the hire. They do not get a second email from IAS. A rehire email is sent from Email Services. If they are still logged into ONB 2.0, they can even refresh their browser to continue Onboarding.
  5. Rehire completes their Onboarding tasks with their existing IAS credentials.

Now, with the IAS/IPS tenant migration and the real-time sync, below the new process:

  1. Steps 1-3 above are the same.
  2. Hire now gets a second Hire/Welcome email from IAS. They are required to re-authenticate and specify a new password. The old password no longer works.
  3. Rehire completes their Onboarding tasks with their new IAS credentials.

Ideally, we’d love the process to retain the Onboardee’s prior IAS credentials, even with the real-time sync and the tenant migration in place. Has anyone solved this? 

Regards,

Jay Crowley

entry.title: 文档附件是否支持在线预览？每次点击附件需下载打开比较麻烦
entry.content:
Hi，SAP专家老师。
打扰一下。
1、目前我们公司在使用EC、RCM、PGM等模块时，包括工作流功能时，会有大量附件产生，HR需下载才能打开查看，相对比较费事；

2、基于此，我们想了解确认下，是否支持文档附件点击时，可以支持HR在线预览，而不是目前只要点击附件就下载。如系统功能支持，请问这块的系统配置点在哪里，谢谢。

entry.title: Manage group to team assignments for SAC within Identity Provisioning
entry.content:
Hi experts,

For our BTP landscape and SAP Cloud we have set up a central Cloud Identity Service (CIS) tenant to centralize the user management.

Now, for SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) we have configured our central CIS tenant as bundled Cloud Identity Service tenant based on SAP help link:
Authentication Options | SAP Help Portal. 

Following this procedure a source and target system in the Identity Provisioning are automatically created. We just adapted the properties of the source system to include "idds.group.filter" and "idds.user.filter". On the target system we set the user and password according to the OAuth client created in SAC and added properties "ips.delete.threshold.groups" and "ips.delete.threshold.users".

Within the CIS we have following groups maintained for SAC:

CIS GroupSAC team

Technical name:
sac_dev_admin

Display name:
SAC Administrators (on Dev)

sac_admin

Technical name:
sac_dev_planning_user

Display name:
SAC Planning User (on Dev)

sac_planning_user

Technical name:
sac_dev_reporting_user

Display name:
SAC Reporting User (on Dev)

sac_reporting_user

Now, we want to adapt the transformation within the target system for SAC to ensure that all users assigned to the CIS groups will be assigned to the according SAC teams (example: users in group "sac_dev_reporting_user" should be assigned to the "sac_reporting_user" team in SAC)

We tried following:

{
	"user": {
		"condition": "isValidEmail($.emails[0].value) && (('%sac.group.prefix%' === 'null') || ($.groups[?(@.display =~ /%sac.group.prefix%.*/)] empty false))",
		"mappings": [
			...,
			{
				"sourcePath": "$.groups[*].value",
				"preserveArrayWithSingleElement": true,
				"optional": true,
				"targetPath": "$.groups[?(@.value)]",
				"functions": [
					{
						"function": "replaceString",
						"target": "sac_dev_admin",
						"replacement": "sac_admin"
					},
					{
						"function": "replaceString",
						"target": "sac_dev_planning_user",
						"replacement": "sac_planning_user"
					},
					{
						"function": "replaceString",
						"target": "sac_dev_reporting_user",
						"replacement": "sac_reporting_user"
					}
				]
			},
			...
		]
	},
	"group": {
		...
	}
}

Unfortunately, this was not working. Instead all team and role assignments were removed from all users.

How can we handle CIS group to SAC team assignments within the Identity Provisioning when group and team name differ?

It must be ensured that not only the initial assignment can be handled via Identity Provisioning but updates as well (such as changes in the CIS group assignments as well as removal from CIS groups).

 

regards

René

entry.title: How can I user power query to get data from sap Cloud Identity Service (IAS)?
entry.content:
Hello experts!

I am trying to use to Excel and Power Query to create a refreshable Excel sheet to export the full list of users from IAS.

Thus far I have been able to use the "From Web" get data option in Excel pointing to our IAS Tenant (https://my.accounts.ondemand.com/scim/Users).

Power Query is able to connect where it downloads a file and processes is as JSON. However, instead of the users' data, I get a summary.  Does anyone have some experience with this that can help?

entry.title: Integrate Sailpoint with SAP CIS to provision to S4HANA public cloud?
entry.content: I am looking for integration guidance connecting Sailpoint with SAP CiS to manage user provisioning to S4HANA Public cloud. I understand SCIM may be supported. What are the best practises and connectors available to enable this integration?

entry.title: Migration of Cloud Identity Services Tenants in BTP NEO
entry.content:
Dear SAP colleagues,

I have a question regarding Cloud Identity Services tenants and would like to share the context to get some help.

Current Situation

  • We currently have a Cloud Identity Services structure as a legacy service in the SAP BTP NEO environment.
  • This service will be discontinued by the end of 2028.

My Question

Is it possible to create a new Cloud Identity Services (IAS/IPS) structure in BTP Cloud Foundry without having to migrate the existing tenant from NEO, thus avoiding potential impacts on connected systems

Additional Context

  • The company recently purchased SAP S/4HANA Rise Private Edition to replace the legacy SAP ECC.
  • We do not have detailed documentation on how the services were configured in Cloud Identity Services within the NEO environment.
  • Our idea is to create a new IAS/IPS structure directly in Cloud Foundry, with separate environments for DEV and PRD, to connect and configure the new systems and products of S/4HANA Rise Private Edition.
Has anyone faced this situation or can confirm if this approach is possible?
Thank you in advance for your help!

entry.title: How can we connect our SAP IAS system to SAP to our BTP system
entry.content:
We are trying to follow the steps as per SP User Information | SAP Help Portal but unable to connect due to 401 not authorized error. we tried providing our admin user credentials from the IAS server but the error persists. Please advise on this issue.

We need this connection for one of our SAP BTP application where activation date details are required as data for the report.

entry.title: SAP IAS Admin Console
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

What would be the best way to secure the SAP IAS Administration Console?

Is it a good idea to restrict access to a specific IP range (e.g. only the company network)? I’m concerned about locking myself out in case the IP address changes.

Or would it be better to implement 2FA for an admin group containing all admins? In that case, there’s also the risk of locking myself out.

I would appreciate your experiences and tips!

Many Thanks 

Best Regards
